title: install windows from iso using NTBoot?

forumNotes.author: TheRookie
forumNotes.content:
Hello People,  

I'm having a problem trying to install windows from an ISO file using NTBoot.  

For now, I have elected to try first with Windows XP, and have gotten as far as step2.  

Below are my commands trying to install xp:  
title Windows Xp step1  
root (hd0,0)  
(hd0,0)/boot/ntboot/ntboot iso_inst=winvblk cdrom=(hd0,0)/isos/xpsp3.iso  
Works fine.  
:smile:  
title windows Xp step2  
root (hd0,0)  
(hd0,0)/boot/ntboot/ntboot iso_inst=winvblk cdrom=(hd0,0)/isos/xpsp3.iso boot=harddisk  

Setup starts, but then complains of not being able to copy files once I click on ok, it looks for the cd-rom in drive j.  

1. How did you using NTBoot manage to have the cdrom present at step 2?  
1.a are there additional commands that I may be missing?  

I gather if I substitute windows xp for windows 7 and winvblk for vboot or firadisk I'd still get a similar error?  

answers would be much appreciated!  
:smile:
